dmca.title: ABUSE] travelsalaska.com]
dmca.body:
nc 

-----Original Message-----
From: The Planet Policy Enforcement [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] 
Sent: Wednesday, June 22, 2005 12:13 PM
To: scorrey@alaskatia.org; copyright@theplanet.com
Subject: [Fwd: [ABUSE] travelsalaska.com]

-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

Your email is being forwarded on to our Copyright counsel for review, at the
address of copyright@theplanet.com.

- -------- Original Message --------
Subject: [ABUSE] travelsalaska.com
Date: Fri, 17 Jun 2005 15:42:06 -0800
From: Scott Correy <scorrey@alaskatia.org>
To: <abuse@theplanet.com>

The owner of travelsalaska.com which is hosted by you has been copying the
websites of our members in their entirety and publishing these copies with
changes only to the email addresses to make it appear that these are the
legitimate business sites of our members , which they are not, in order to
mislead customers. A prime example is if you compare his site as it exists
currently to:

http://www.homeshore.com/

This is clearly a violation of his TOS as far as I can tell.
This is the third instance of this that we have seen as he changes his site
every few weeks. Please contact me via phone or email ASAP with any
questions you may have.


                Scott Correy

                Communications Technology Coordinator

                Alaska Travel Industry Association

                (907)646-3316




- --
Thanks,
Policy Enforcement
The Planet Internet Services, Inc.
http://www.theplanet.com/aup/
-----BEGIN PGP SIGNATURE-----
Version: GnuPG v1.2.5 (MingW32)
Comment: Using GnuPG with Thunderbird - http://enigmail.mozdev.org

iD8DBQFCuZwbvK/XpJs6oyURAmFkAKCb0ndLlXBp+LUV3BLrl8pVy1a9ngCfZf5Y
81jlNaRphKRHy3EtuGW6BVY=
=u6qv
-----END PGP SIGNATURE-----
